#summary The usual hello world example.
#labels Phase-Implementation
{{{
public Hello implements se.rupy.http.Service {
	public int index() { return 0; }
	public String identifier() { return "/hello"; }
	public void create() {}
	public void destroy() {}
	public void remove(Session session, int type) {}
	public void filter(Event event) throws Event, IOException {
		event.reply().output().print("hello");
	}
}
}}}
Compile the Hello class above and put it in a jar file (hello.jar in the example below) together with any static content you wish to deploy. The static content has to be placed under a service identifier (/hello/... in the jar) for it to be accessible, this limitation exists so services can't overwrite each others content. Finally, upload it with your ant script like this:
{{{
<target name="deploy">
	<java fork="yes" classname="se.rupy.http.Deploy" classpath="http.jar">
		<arg line="localhost:8000"/>
		<arg line="hello.jar"/>
	</java>
</target>
}}}
Now try browsing to http://localhost:8000/hello.
